contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{nihongo|'''Hikami'''|氷上郡|Hikami-gun}} was a [[districts of Japan|district]] located in [[Hyōgo Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. On November 1, 2004 all six towns in the district merged to form the city of [[Tamba, Hyōgo|Tamba]], thereby dissolving the district. As of 2003, the Hikami district had an estimated [[population]] of 71,753 and a [[population density|density]] of 145.46 persons per km². The total area was 493.28 km². ==Former towns and villages== * [[Aogaki, Hyōgo|Aogaki]] * [[Hikami, Hyōgo|Hikami]] * [[Ichijima, Hyōgo|Ichijima]] * [[Kaibara, Hyōgo|Kaibara]] * [[Kasuga, Hyōgo|Kasuga]] * [[Sannan, Hyōgo|Sannan]] ==Merger== *On November 1, 2004 the towns of [[Hikami, Hyōgo|Hikami]], [[Aogaki, Hyōgo|Aogaki]], [[Ichijima, Hyōgo|Ichijima]], [[Kaibara, Hyōgo|Kaibara]], [[Kasuga, Hyōgo|Kasuga]] and [[Sannan, Hyōgo|Sannan]] merged to form the new city of [[Tamba, Hyōgo|Tamba]]. {{Hyogo}} {{coord missing|Hyōgo Prefecture}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hikami District, Hyogo}} [[Category:Former districts of Hyōgo Prefecture]] {{Hyogo-geo-stub}}
